meanings.sent1: She was fubbing her friend by pretending to agree with her.
meanings.sent2: He got caught fubbing on the test by looking at his neighbor's paper.
meanings.sent3: The magician was fubbing the audience with his clever tricks.
meanings.sent4: The fox fubbed the rabbit by pretending to be its friend.
meanings.sent5: The con artist was fubbing people out of their money with his scams.

meanings.definition: To avoid or neglect (a duty or responsibility)
meanings.sent1: He kept fubbing his chores by playing video games instead.
meanings.sent2: She fubbed her homework and had to stay up late to finish it.
meanings.sent3: The student was fubbing his assignment by claiming the dog ate it.
meanings.sent4: The employee fubbed his work responsibilities and got a warning from his boss.
meanings.sent5: The politician was fubbing his promises to the voters by not following through on his pledges.

meanings.definition: To handle or deal with (something) in a careless or ineffective way
meanings.sent1: She was fubbing the fragile vase and accidentally dropped it.
meanings.sent2: He fubbed the presentation by forgetting his notes and stumbling over his words.
meanings.sent3: The chef was fubbing the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic fubbed the repair job, causing the car to break down again.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was fubbing the classroom management, leading to chaos during the lesson.
